citation.article-title: Humibacillus xanthopallidus gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Humibacillus (Hu.mi.ba.cil′lus. L. fem. n. humus soil; L. masc. n. bacillus rod; N.L. masc. n. Humibacillus rod isolated from soil).
The peptidoglycan is of A3γ type, containing ll-A2pm, glycine, alanine and glutamic acid.
The major cellular fatty acids are a complex mixture of straight-chain saturated, monounsaturated, and iso- and anteiso-methyl-branched components.
The DNA G+C content is 69–70 mol%.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Intrasporangiaceae, suborder Micrococcineae.
With regard to signature nucleotides defined for the family Intrasporangiaceae, at pair positions 1134 to 1140 strain KV-663T has an A–U rather than a G–C pair.
The type species is Humibacillus xanthopallidus.
